docs.text: Writing Beautiful Docs Docs doesn't have to be hard. Especially with PowerShell. Combine PlatyPS with mkdocs, and all you need to worry about is your comment-based help. This documenation was automatically generated in a build pipeline for my talk "Generating Beautiful Documentation" for the Raleigh PowerShell User Group, held on 18 August 2021. Use this code! All the code available in the repository at https://github.com/steviecoaster/BeautifulDocs can be used as a baseline to implement this in your organization, or in your personal projects. Enjoy! Questions? I love interacting with the community. Find me on Twitter @steviecoaster.

docs.text: Remove-ChocoTemplateComment SYNOPSIS Removes code comments from a templated choco package. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Remove-ChocoTemplateComment -Script C:\Temp\MyScript.ps1 EXAMPLE 2 Remove-ChocoTemplateComment -PackageSource C:\Temp\MyPackage PARAMETERS -Script The script to remove comments from. docs.text: Set-NonDomainRemoting SYNOPSIS Configures a system to allow WinRM management of non-domain-joined computers. SYNTAX Set-NonDomainRemoting [-TrustedHosts] <String[]> [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Configures a system to allow WinRM management of non-domain-joined computers. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Set-NonDomainRemoting -TrustedHosts "192.168.1.1,192.168.1.2" PARAMETERS -TrustedHosts The list of hostname or IP addresses that are allowed to connect to the WinRM listener.
